title: Remember The Iconic Scene Where Joker Dances On Stairs? The Place Has Become A Tourist Hotspot
text:
Remember The Iconic Scene Where Joker Dances On Stairs? The Place Has Become A Tourist Hotspot

Remember The Iconic Scene Where Joker Dances On Stairs? The Place Has Become A Tourist Hotspot

Todd Phillips' Joker and Joaquin Phoenix’s brilliant performance in it has taken the world by storm. Joker is already being considered one of the most iconic movies of the decade and rightly so.

The degradation of society reflected through the character of Arthur Fleck struck a chord with people.

While the Joker in The Dark Knight, the character made immortal by Heath Ledger, wanted to watch the society and the world burn, Todd Phillips' Joker was shown to be a creation of the society.

joaquin as joker dancing and smoking on those stairs is one of the best things to ever happen in movies. pic.twitter.com/mkP0RDJTYJ — kaz. (@joaquinsjoker) October 19, 2019

One of the most iconic scenes from the movie features the complete transformation of Arthur Fleck into the Joker, and him embracing his dark side so to say. It is the dance that follows on the stairs/steps of the rotting city that went on to achieve cult status.

Youtube Screenshot

Don't Miss 407 SHARES 6 K SHARES 968 SHARES

The steps where the dance scene was shot have unsurprisingly have no become a famous tourist attraction after a number of people figured out its location.

Reportedly, the stairs connect Shakespeare and Anderson avenues at West 167th Street in the Bronx, in New York City.

Fans and tourists have been flocking to the stairs to get clicked ever since. Some even put on the costume of the Joker.

I found the Joker stairs. Take the 4 train up to 167th Street in the Bronx. Photo: @OneMillicentCho and @cogitatotomato. 🤡 pic.twitter.com/0xrTPM2tG9 — Eliza Romero | Aesthetic Distance (@aesthdistance1) October 18, 2019

WENT TO THEM JOKER STAIRS 🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡🤡 pic.twitter.com/eK109XYWU4 — I'm trying to aliven't (@MetriAndReyes) October 12, 2019

"DINNERS READY!"

*Me coming down the stairs after seeing Joker*: pic.twitter.com/fF1CG3gIEe — Boba Fetty Wap (@The_Green_Blur) October 19, 2019

The scene where Arthur Fleck is dancing and smoking as if he has no cares in the world and no more damns to give is a piece of art. No wonder people want to be associated with it in some way.
